tit.j: 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線

sen.j: 烏丸線（からすません）は、京都府京都市左京区の国際会館駅から同市伏見区の竹田駅 (京都府)までを結ぶ京都市営地下鉄の路線である。
sen.e: Karasuma Line is a part of the Kyoto Municipal Subway in Kyoto city, Kyoto, running from Kokusaikaikan Station (Sakyo-ward) to Takeda Station (Fushimi-ward)
Karasuma Line is a part of the Kyoto Municipal Subway in Kyoto city, Kyoto, running from Kokusaikaikan Station (Sakyo-ward) to Takeda Station (Fushimi-ward).
Karasuma Line is a part of the Kyoto Municipal Subway in Kyoto city, Kyoto, running from Kokusaikaikan Station (Sakyo-ward) to Takeda Station (Fushimi-ward).

sen.j: 京都市最初の市営地下鉄路線。
sen.e: It was the first municipal subway line to be constructed in Kyoto city.
It was the first municipal subway line to be constructed in Kyoto city.
It was the first municipal subway line to be constructed in Kyoto city.

sen.j: 北大路～十条間は烏丸通の地下を通る。
sen.e: The section between Kitaoji Station and Jujo Station passes under Karasuma Street.
The section between Kitaoji Station and Jujo Station passes under Karasuma Street.
The section between Kitaoji Station and Jujo Station passes under Karasuma Street.

sen.j: 現在は全列車が6両編成だが、ホーム長として、それ以上の長さに対応できるようになっている駅がある。
sen.e: All trains are 6 cars long now, but there are some stations long enough for trains having more than 6 cars.
All trains are 6 cars long now, but there are some stations long enough for trains with more than 6 cars.

sen.j: 沿線には大学が多いため学生利用が多い。
sen.e: There are many colleges along this line, so many students use it.

sen.e: Some of the main universities/colleges, starting from the first station, are:

sen.j: ・京都精華大学（国際会館駅からシャトルバス。

sen.j: がある。

etc.

sen.j: また当然、京都観光に来た観光客の利用も多いが、沿線周辺の主要な観光地は京都御所（今出川駅、丸太町駅）や繁華街（烏丸御池駅、四条駅）くらいしかない。
sen.e: Many tourists visiting Kyoto use this line too, but major sightseeing spots along it are very few, like Kyoto Imperial Palace (Imadegawa Station, Marutamachi Station), main streets (Karasuma Oike Station), etc.

Many tourists visiting Kyoto use this line too, but major sightseeing spots along it are very few, like Kyoto Imperial Palace (Imadegawa Station, Marutamachi Station), and main streets (Karasuma Oike Station), etc.

Many tourists visiting Kyoto use this line too, but major sightseeing spots along it are very few, like Kyoto Imperial Palace (Imadegawa Station, Marutamachi Station), and main streets (Karasuma Oike Station), etc.

sen.j: そのために主要観光地へは京都市営地下鉄東西線に乗り換えるか、地下鉄の各駅から京都市営バス・京都バスなどの路線バス利用となることが多い。
sen.e: So they usually change over to the Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line or take local buses such as Kyoto City Bus, Kyoto Bus, etc from each subway station.
So they usually change over to the Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line or take local buses such as Kyoto City Bus, Kyoto Bus, etc from each subway station.
So they usually change over to the Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line or take local buses such as Kyoto City Bus, Kyoto Bus, etc from each subway station.

sen.j: 線内折り返し運転のほかに、竹田駅から近鉄京都線に乗り入れ直通運転を行っている。
sen.e: In addition to a service going up and down the line, there is a direct extended service from Takeda Station to Kintetsu Kyoto Line.
In addition to a service going up and down the line, there is a direct extended service from Takeda Station to Kintetsu Kyoto Line.
In addition to a service going up and down the line, there is a direct extended service from Takeda Station to Kintetsu Kyoto Line.

sen.j: 昼間時間帯は近鉄京都線とダイヤサイクルを合わせるため7分半ごとに1時間8本（線内折り返し4本、新田辺直通普通2本、奈良直通急行2本）が運転される。
sen.e: In the daytime, they have eight trains an hour, every 7.5 minutes (four trains going up and down the line, two local trains bound for Shin-Tanabe Station and two Express trains bound for Kintetsu-Nara Station) to match their schedule with the Kintetsu Kyoto Line's.
sen.cmt: （近鉄）奈良（駅）→JR奈良駅と区別される
sen.e: In the daytime, they have eight trains an hour, every 7.5 minutes (four trains going up and down the line, two local trains bound for Shin-Tanabe Station and two Express trains bound for Kintetsu-Nara Station) to match their schedule with the Kintetsu Kyoto Line's.

In the daytime, they have eight trains an hour, every 7.5 minutes (four trains going up and down the line, two local trains bound for Shin-Tanabe Station and two Express trains bound for Kintetsu-Nara Station) to match their schedule with the Kintetsu Kyoto Line's.

sen.j: 全線が都心を通る烏丸線内は全線通しの運転のみで区間運転はないため、利用者の多い京都～烏丸御池間は混雑し、両端の竹田及び国際会館に向かうほど閑散とする。
sen.e: The train is crowded between Kyoto and Karasuma, but gets quieter the further it gets to the ends of the line.
The train is crowded between Kyoto and Karasuma, but gets quieter the closer it gets to either end of the line.
The train is crowded between Kyoto and Karasuma, but gets quieter the closer it gets to either end of the line.

sen.j: 平日昼間より土休日昼間の方が利用者が多い。
sen.e: people use this line in the daytime on the weekends rather than on the weekdays.
People use this line more in the daytime on the weekends rather than on the weekdays.
People use this line more in the daytime on the weekends rather than on the weekdays.

tit.e: Trains going Up and Down the line
Trains going Up and Down the line
Trains going Up and Down the line

sen.j: 線内折り返し列車は、昼間は毎時4本運転される。
sen.e: They have trains going up and down from one end of the line to the other four times an hour during the day.
They have trains going up and down from one end of the line to the other four times an hour during the day.
They have trains going up and down from one end of the line to the other four times an hour during the day.

sen.j: 駅の行き先案内や方向幕は、単に「国際会館」「竹田」と表示される。
sen.e: The platform guideboards in the stations and the destination signs on the train say simply "Kokusaikaikan" or "Takeda".
The platform guideboards in the stations and the destination signs on the trains say simply "Kokusaikaikan" or "Takeda".
The platform guideboards in the stations and the destination signs on the trains say simply "Kokusaikaikan" or "Takeda."

tit.e: Local trains going all the way to Shin-Tanabe
Local trains going all the way to Shin-Tanabe
Local trains going all the way to Shin-Tanabe

sen.j: 近鉄京都線新田辺駅発着の列車が、昼間は毎時2本（30分間隔）運転される。
sen.e: They have two trains in an hour (every 30 minutes), which arrive at and departs from Kintetsu-Kyoto Line Shin-Tanabe Station in the daytime.
They have two trains in an hour (every 30 minutes), which arrive at and depart from Kintetsu-Kyoto Line Shin-Tanabe Station in the daytime.
They have two trains in an hour (every 30 minutes), which arrive at and depart from Kintetsu-Kyoto Line Shin-Tanabe Station in the daytime.

sen.j: 方向幕は「普通｜新田辺」「普通｜国際会館」で、烏丸線内でもそのままの表示である。
sen.e: The destination signs on the train say "Local/Shin-Tanabe" and "Local/Kokusaikaikan", and remain that way even within the Karasuma Line.
The destination signs on the trains say "Local/Shin-Tanabe" and "Local/Kokusaikaikan", and remain that way even within the Karasuma Line.
The destination signs on the trains say "Local/Shin-Tanabe" and "Local/Kokusaikaikan," and remain that way even within the Karasuma Line.

sen.j: 早朝に1本のみ近鉄宮津駅発国際会館行き普通が運転されている（近鉄宮津行きの列車はない）。
sen.e: They have only one train bound for Kokusaikaikan Station from Kintetsu Miyazu Station in the early morning. (There is no train bound for Kintetsu Miyazu Station.)
They have only one train bound for Kokusaikaikan Station from Kintetsu Miyazu Station in the early morning (there is no train bound for Kintetsu Miyazu Station).
They have only one train bound for Kokusaikaikan Station from Kintetsu Miyazu Station in the early morning (there is no train bound for Kintetsu Miyazu Station).

sen.j: 同志社大学京田辺キャンパスに近い興戸駅は急行が停まらないのと烏丸線直通普通が新田辺折返のため近鉄普通の運転間隔が7分半～22分半間隔に開いていて不便なため、新田辺駅へ乗入れる普通電車の近鉄宮津駅への延長の要望もある（詳しくは興戸駅の項を参照）。
sen.e: Because Express trains don't stop at Kodo Station, which is near the Doshisha University Kyotanabe Campus, and because the intervals between local trains stopping at Kodo Station vary from 7.5 minutes to 22.5 minutes due to their turning back at Shin-Tanabe, some people have requested local trains going through to Shin-Tanabe Station up to Kintetsu Miyazu Station (Please see the page of "Kodo Station".)

Because Express trains don't stop at Kodo Station, which is near the Doshisha University Kyotanabe Campus, and because the intervals between local trains stopping at Kodo Station vary from 7.5 minutes to 22.5 minutes due to their turning back at Shin-Tanabe, some people have requested local trains going through to Shin-Tanabe Station up to Kintetsu Miyazu Station (refer to the article on "Kodo Station".)

sen.e: Because Express trains don't stop at Kodo Station, which is near the Doshisha University Kyotanabe Campus, and because the intervals between local trains stopping at Kodo Station vary from 7.5 minutes to 22.5 minutes due to their turning back at Shin-Tanabe, some people have requested local trains going through to Shin-Tanabe Station up to Kintetsu Miyazu Station (refer to the article on "Kodo Station".)

tit.e: Express trains going straight through to the Kintetsu-Nara Line Kintetsu Nara station

sen.j: 近鉄奈良駅発着の急行列車（烏丸線内は各駅停車）が、昼間時間帯に（平日は朝にも）毎時2本（30分間隔）運転される。
sen.e: They have two Express trains (though they stop at every station in the Karasuma Line) in an hour (every 30 minutes), which arrive at and depart from Kintetsu-Nara Station in the daytime (and in the morning on weekdays).

They have two Express trains (though they stop at every station in the Karasuma Line) in an hour (every 30 minutes), which arrive at and depart from Kintetsu-Nara Station in the daytime (and in the morning on weekdays).

sen.j: 方向幕は「急行｜奈良」「急行｜京都国際会館」であるが、国際会館行きは竹田で単に「国際会館」と表示を変更する（されずに直通する場合もある）。
sen.e: The destination signs on the train say "Express/Nara" and "Express/Kokusaikaikan", but the latter turns to "Kokusaikaikan" at Takeda Station (though some trains do not make the change.).
The destination signs on the trains say "Express/Nara" and "Express/Kokusaikaikan", but the latter turns to "Kokusaikaikan" at Takeda Station (though some trains do not make the change).

sen.j: 注）近鉄線では地下鉄線と直通運転を行う竹田～新田辺・近鉄奈良間のみで運行。
sen.e: Note: Within the Kintetsu-Line, they run only between Takeda Station and Shin-Tanabe or Kintetsu-Nara Station, going straight through the Subway Line.
Note: Within the Kintetsu-Line, they run only between Takeda Station and Shin-Tanabe or Kintetsu-Nara Station, going straight through the Subway Line.

sen.j: 近鉄線のみでの運行はなし。
sen.e: There is no operation by Kintetsu-Line alone.
There is no operation by Kintetsu-Line alone.

sen.j: 烏丸線内での方向幕としては、国際会館、竹田の他に京都（近鉄車は近鉄京都行きがあるため使用）、北大路、北山のかつての終着駅、そして烏丸御池行きのものがある。
sen.e: The destination signs on the train within the Karasuma Line other than "Kokusaikaikan"and "Takeda"are "Kyoto"(for some Kintetsu trains bound for Kintetsu-Kyoto Station), "Kitaoji"and "Kitayama"(which used to be the ends of the line), and "Karasuma Oike".

The destination signs on the trains within the Karasuma Line, other than "Kokusaikaikan" and "Takeda", are "Kyoto" (for some Kintetsu trains bound for Kintetsu-Kyoto Station), "Kitaoji" and "Kitayama" (which used to be the end of the line), and "Karasuma Oike".

The destination signs on the trains within the Karasuma Line, other than "Kokusaikaikan" and "Takeda," are "Kyoto" (for some Kintetsu trains bound for Kintetsu-Kyoto Station), "Kitaoji" and "Kitayama" (which used to be the end of the line), and "Karasuma Oike".
sen.cmt: カンマ、ピリオド位置修正、スペースの重複を削除

sen.j: 普段は使われることはない烏丸御池行きの方向幕だが、2005年5月23日の京都駅での発煙騒ぎの際に使われたことがある（地下鉄の車両は一部を除き、非常渡り線のある駅の行き先も入っている）。
sen.e: The "Karasuma Oike"signs are not normally used, there is a case that they were used on May 23 2005, when smoke appeared inside Kyoto station. (The names of the stations having emergency crossovers are included in most of the subway cars' destination signs.)

The "Karasuma Oike" signs are not normally used, although they were used on May 23 2005, when smoke appeared inside Kyoto station (the names of the stations with emergency crossovers are included in most of the subway cars' destination signs).

sen.j: 注）両者とも近鉄京都線、近鉄橿原線（急行のみ、主に近鉄京都発着）、近鉄天理線（急行のみ、運用数は稀少）、近鉄奈良線（主に普通、区間準急、準急）でも運行されている。
sen.e: Note: Both cars also run along the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, Kintetsu Kashihara Line (Only as an Express train, mainly arriving at and departing from Kintetsu-Kyoto Station), at the Kintetsu Tenri Line (Only as an Express train, very few trains) and the Kintetsu Nara Line (Mainly as Local, Suburban Semi-Express, Semi-Express and Rapid Express).

Note: Both cars also run on the Kintetsu Kyoto and Kintetsu Kashihara Lines (only as an Express train, mainly arriving at and departing from Kintetsu-Kyoto Station), at the Kintetsu Tenri Line (Only as an Express train, very few trains) and the Kintetsu Nara Line (mainly as Local, Suburban Semi-Express, Semi-Express and Rapid Express).

Note: Both cars also run on the Kintetsu Kyoto and Kintetsu Kashihara Lines (only as an Express train, mainly arriving at and departing from Kintetsu-Kyoto Station), at the Kintetsu Tenri Line (Only as an Express train, very few trains) and the Kintetsu Nara Line (mainly as Local, Suburban Semi-Express, Semi-Express and Rapid Express).

sen.j: 終日近鉄線内のみ、もしくは地下鉄烏丸線内のみの運用もある。
sen.e: Some trains run only within the Kintetsu Line or only within the Karasuma Line all day long.
Some trains run only within the Kintetsu Line or only within the Karasuma Line all day long.
Some trains run only within the Kintetsu Line or only within the Karasuma Line all day long.

sen.j: 京都駅では烏丸線、近鉄線双方のホームに乗り入れている。
sen.e: At Kyoto station, they the Karasuma Line and the Kintetsu Line both use each other's platforms.
At Kyoto station, the Karasuma Line and the Kintetsu Line both use each other's platforms.
At Kyoto station, the Karasuma Line and the Kintetsu Line both use each other's platforms.

sen.j: 方向幕は京都市交車と同じ種別・行き先に加えて、近鉄線のみで使用する「京都駅」、「天理駅」、「橿原神宮前駅」、「近鉄難波駅」、「東花園駅」、「東生駒駅」、「大和西大寺駅」、「近鉄奈良駅」（普通、区間準急、準急、快速急行）等も入っている。
sen.e: In addition to the same destination signs as the Kyoto Municipal Subway, they also have destination signs used only for the Kintetsu-Line such as "Kyoto Station", "Tenri Station","Kashiharajingu-mae Station","Kintetsu-Namba Station", "Higashi-Hanazono Station", "Higashi-Ikoma Station", "Yamato-Saidaiji Station" and "Kintetsu-Nara Station (Local, Suburban Semi-Express, Semi-Express and Rapid Express)", etc.

In addition to the same destination signs as the Kyoto Municipal Subway, they also have destination signs used only for the Kintetsu-Line such as "Kyoto Station", "Tenri Station", "Kashiharajingu-mae Station", "Kintetsu-Namba Station", "Higashi-Hanazono Station", "Higashi-Ikoma Station", "Yamato-Saidaiji Station" and "Kintetsu-Nara Station (Local, Suburban Semi-Express, Semi-Express and Rapid Express)", etc.

In addition to the same destination signs as the Kyoto Municipal Subway, they also have destination signs used only for the Kintetsu-Line such as "Kyoto Station", "Tenri Station", "Kashiharajingu-mae Station", "Kintetsu-Nanba Station", "Higashi-Hanazono Station", "Higashi-Ikoma Station", "Yamato-Saidaiji Station" and "Kintetsu-Nara Station (Local, Suburban Semi-Express, Semi-Express and Rapid Express)", etc.

sen.j: 1981年（昭和56年）5月29日 北大路～京都間が開業。
sen.e: On May 29, 1981, service began on the section between Kitaoji Station and Kyoto Station.
On May 29, 1981, service began on the section between Kitaoji Station and Kyoto Station.
On May 29, 1981, service began on the section between Kitaoji Station and Kyoto Station.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）6月11日 京都～竹田間が開業。
sen.e: Service began on the section from Kyoto to Takeda Station on June 11, 1988.
Service began on the section from Kyoto to Takeda Station on June 11, 1988.
Service began on the section from Kyoto to Takeda Station on June 11, 1988.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）8月28日 近鉄京都線と相互直通運転開始。
sen.e: On August 28, 1988, the Karasuma Line and the Kintetsu-Kyoto Line started running each other's tracks.
On August 28, 1988, the Karasuma Line and the Kintetsu-Kyoto Line started running on each other's tracks.
On August 28, 1988, the Karasuma Line and the Kintetsu-Kyoto Line started running on each other's tracks.

sen.j: 新田辺駅まで。
sen.e: to Shin-Tanabe Station.
To Shin-Tanabe Station.
To Shin-Tanabe Station.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）10月24日 北山～北大路間が開業。
sen.e: On October 24, 1990, service began on the section between Kitayama and Kitaoji station.
On October 24, 1990, service began on the section between Kitayama and Kitaoji station.
On October 24, 1990, service began on the section between Kitayama and Kitaoji station.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）5月22日 京都市営地下鉄東西線の開業に先立って御池駅を烏丸御池駅に改称。
sen.e: On May 22, "Oike Station"was renamed "Karasuma Oike" for the coming Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line's opening.
On May 22, "Oike Station" was renamed "Karasuma Oike" for the coming Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line's opening.
On May 22, "Oike Station" was renamed "Karasuma Oike" for the coming Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line's opening.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）6月3日 国際会館～北山間が開業。
sen.e: The section between Kitaoji Station and Kyoto Station opened on June 3, 1997.
The section between Kitaoji Station and Kyoto Station opened on June 3, 1997.
The section between Kitaoji Station and Kyoto Station opened on June 3, 1997.

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）3月15日 国際会館～近鉄奈良間直通の急行を運転開始。
sen.e: Express trains started running directly between Kokusaikaikan Station and Kintetsu Nara Station on March 15, 2008.
Express trains started running directly between Kokusaikaikan Station and Kintetsu Nara Station on March 15, 2008.
Express trains started running directly between Kokusaikaikan Station and Kintetsu Nara Station on March 15, 2008.

sen.j: 油小路通は高度集積地区に指定されており、活性化を期待して、竹田駅から近鉄京都線と分岐し横大路付近までの4.4kmを延伸する計画がある。
sen.e: Aburanokoji Street has been designated a "high-accumulation area"(Urban development project), and there is a plan to have the Karasuma Line deverge from the Kintetsu-Kyoto Line and extend 4.4km from Takeda Station to near Yokooji.
sen.cmt: 高度集積地区→英名あるかどうか不明（ＨＰには英語ページなし）
sen.e: Aburanokoji Street has been designated a "high-accumulation area" (Urban Development Project), and there is a plan to have the Karasuma Line diverge from the Kintetsu-Kyoto Line and extend 4.4km from Takeda Station to near Yokooji.

Aburanokoji Street has been designated a "high congestion area" (Urban Development Project), and there is a plan to have the Karasuma Line diverge from the Kintetsu-Kyoto Line and extend 4.4km from Takeda Station to near Yokooji.
sen.cmt: 高度集積地区→"high congestion area"

sen.j: ルートは大手筋の下を通り、京阪本線の中書島駅と淀駅の間付近までとなっている。
sen.e: It is said that the route will be between Keihan Main Line Chushojima Station and Yodo Station, passing under Otesuji.
The route will be between Keihan Main Line's Chushojima Station and Yodo Station, passing under Otesuji.
The route will be between Keihan Main Line's Chushojima Station and Yodo Station, passing under Otesuji.

sen.j: 近畿地方交通審議会（国土交通省の諮問機関）が2004年10月8日に中長期的に望まれる鉄道ネットワークとして、竹田駅以南の延伸計画を答申した。
sen.e: On October 8, 2004, the Council for Kinki Regional Transport (an advisory body to the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism) announced a plan to extend the subway south of Takeda Station for a better railway network from the mid-long term perspective.

On October 8, 2004, the Council for Kinki Regional Transport (an advisory body to the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism) announced a plan to extend the subway south of Takeda Station for a better railway network from the mid-long term perspective.

On October 8, 2004, the Council for Kinki Regional Transport (an advisory body to the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism) announced a plan to extend the subway south of Takeda Station for a better railway network from the mid-long term perspective.

sen.j: 実は昔、三栖までの事業免許を取得する直前まで計画は進んでいたのだが、そのときに伏見の酒造家たちが「地下鉄延長によって酒造に欠かせない地下水（伏水）が出なくなる恐れがある」と計画に猛反発した（なお奈良電気鉄道（奈良電）が1928年に、現在の近鉄京都線を伏見付近において地下線で建設する予定であったときも、同様の反対運動を起こして高架線に変更させたことがあった）ためといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that the plan had advenced to the point of getting the licence for extending the line to Misu, but brewers in Fushimi revolted against it, saying "Subway extension will cause a lack of the clear groundwater (Fushimi 伏水), indispensable for brewing Japanese sake.". (In addition to that, when Nara Electric Railway was planning to construct the existing Kintetsu-Kyoto Line in the immediate area of Fushimi as a subway line, they waged similar opposition campaign and had it changed to an elevated railway.)

It is said that the plan had advanced to the point of getting the licence for extending the line to Misu, but brewers in Fushimi revolted against it, saying "Subway extension will stop the flow of the clear groundwater (Fushimi), indispensable for brewing Japanese sake" (when Nara Electric Railway was planning to construct the existing Kintetsu-Kyoto Line in the immediate area of Fushimi as a subway line, they waged similar opposition campaign and had it changed to an elevated railway).
sen.cmt: cause a lack of->stop the flow of; changed punctuation around parentheses
sen.e: It is said that the plan had advanced to the point of getting the license for extending the line to Misu, but brewers in Fushimi revolted against it, saying "Subway extension will stop the flow of the clear groundwater (Fushimi), indispensable for brewing Japanese sake" (when Nara Electric Railway was planning to construct the existing Kintetsu-Kyoto Line in the immediate area of Fushimi as a subway line, they waged similar opposition campaign and had it changed to an elevated railway).

sen.j: 結局、近鉄京都線に合流する形で新田辺駅まで乗り入れることでまとまったが、後に一部の電車は近鉄奈良駅まで直通するようになっている。
sen.e: In the end, that extension plan was arranged so that Karasuma Line would go through Shin-Tanabe Station to meet Kintetsu-Kyoto Line, but later on some trains started running straight to Kintetsu-Nara Station.

In the end, that extension plan was arranged so that Karasuma Line would go through Shin-Tanabe Station to meet Kintetsu-Kyoto Line, but later on some trains started running straight to Kintetsu-Nara Station.

In the end, that extension plan was arranged so that Karasuma Line would go through Shin-Tanabe Station to meet Kintetsu-Kyoto Line, but later on some trains started running straight to Kintetsu-Nara Station.

sen.j: また、さらに淀川を越えて南進し、宇治川南部に計画されている洛南新都市や松井山手駅まで延伸する構想もある。
sen.e: There is an other plan to extend the Karasuma Line south of the Yodo River up to Rakunan-Shintoshi (planned development south of the Uji River), and Matsuiyamate Station.
There is another plan to extend the Karasuma Line south of the Yodo River up to Rakunan-Shintoshi (planned development south of the Uji River), and Matsuiyamate Station.
There is another plan to extend the Karasuma Line south of the Yodo River up to Rakunan-Shintoshi (planned development south of the Uji River), and Matsuiyamate Station.

sen.j: 一方、北端は岩倉地区まで延伸する構想もあったがこちらは実現の可能性は限りなく低い。
sen.e: There was also a plan to extend the north end of the Karasuma Line up to the Iwakura area, but there is very little chance of it being realized.
There was also a plan to extend the north end of the Karasuma Line up to the Iwakura area, but there is very little chance of it being realized.
There was also a plan to extend the north end of the Karasuma Line up to the Iwakura area, but there is very little chance of it being realized.

sen.j: 叡山電鉄（出町柳駅～岩倉駅 (京都府)間）の利用者が減る懸念もある。
sen.e: There is some concerns that users of Eizan Electric Railway might decrease if such a plan were carried out.
There are some concerns that users of Eizan Electric Railway might decrease if such a plan were carried out.
There are some concerns that users of Eizan Electric Railway might decrease if such a plan were carried out.

sen.j: 普通・急行：烏丸線内は各駅に停車。
sen.e: Local, Express : they stop at every station within the Karasuma Line.

sen.j: 乗り入れ区間である竹田～新田辺・近鉄奈良間の停車駅は近鉄京都線を参照。
sen.e: As for the stations between Takeda and Shin-tanabe or Kintetsu-Nara Station, see "Kintetsu-Kyoto line"

sen.j: (1) 東西線の乗降客数を含み、烏丸線・東西線相互間の乗り換え客数は含まない（つまり、烏丸御池駅の改札を通過した人数である）
sen.e: (1)It includes the number of passengers getting on and off the Tozai Line and excludes the number of passengers changing trains from Karasuma Line to Tozai Line or vice versa. (This means that it is the number of passengers who pass the gate at Karasuma Oike Station.)

1. It includes the number of passengers getting on and off the Tozai Line and excludes the number of passengers changing trains from Karasuma Line to Tozai Line or vice versa (i.e. it is the number of passengers who pass the gate at Karasuma Oike Station).

sen.j: (2) 近鉄京都線直通客を含む。

sen.j: (3) 実際の湖西線分岐駅は東海道本線（琵琶湖線）山科駅だが、全ての列車が京都駅から発着し実質的な起点となっているためこの表に掲載した。
sen.e: (3)The actual junction for the Kosei Line is Yamashina Station on the Tokaido Main Line (Biwako Line), but Kyoto Station is the arrival and departure station for all trains and the practical starting point, so we put it in this chart.
